txt: Typically white, upper middle class architects. Some examples: Charles Beasley and his son William, A.A. Cantin, Crim & Scorr, Meyers & Ward, Hamilton Murdock, T. Paterson Ross & A.W. Burgen, Rousseau and Charles Soule (Quan, 1994)
Despite the fact that most Chinese immigrants residing in Chinatown were likely from rural, southern Chinese districts

The people around me held stereotypes based on the visual representation precedent set in media. According to the quips and jokes I was told growing up, Chinese people and culture are: chopsticks, rice, noodles, speaking with a funny accent, lanterns, dragons, kungfu, woks, fortune cookies
jǔ mù wú qīn. Meaning: Be a stranger in a foreign land/not having anyone to rely on. Literal meaning: To raise your eyes and see no loved ones/no one familiar
